## Swiss dataset
The Swiss dataset is standard included in R, [@Rproject.] The extensive data (all provinces, not only the french-speaking) is managed by Princeton University [-@princetonuniversity].

```{r, include=T, echo=F, message = F,  (style="width:80%"), fig.width=0.3}
dat <- datasets::swiss
datatable(dat, options = list(pageLength = 5), extensions = 'FixedColumns')


```

## Scatterplot

```{r, eval = T, echo=F, include = T} 
#*R-code, executed, but not displayed
dat %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Fertility, y = Catholic)) +
  geom_point() +
  ggtitle("Scatterplot of fertility rate and percentage catholics") +
  labs(y="Catholics in the region (in %)", x = "standardised Fertility rate (in %)")
```

## Interactive scatterplot

```{r, echo=F,message=F ,warning = F}

fig <- plot_ly(data = dat, x = ~Fertility, y = ~Catholic, type = "scatter")

fig
```
